snippet: While Augusta National has Amen Corner, TPC Scottsdale has Fraternity Row, the choker chain of humanity that wraps around No. 16, a 162-yard par 3.
abstract: TPC Scottsdale, site of golf's Phoenix Open, is known for the 16th hole, which has five bunkers and five rows of bleachers replete with beer vendors and organized agitators and 177 sky-boxes; Phil Mickelson, who has won the tournament twice since turning pro in 1992, has helped make No 16 popular with fans.
lead_paragraph: While Augusta National has Amen Corner, TPC Scottsdale has Fraternity Row, the choker chain of humanity that wraps around No. 16, a 162-yard par 3.

headline.seo: 16th Hole at PGA’s Phoenix Open Has the Decorum of a Frat Party
headline.main: At This Hole, Golf Captures The Spirit of a Keg Party
headline.print_headline: At This Hole, Golf Captures The Spirit of a Keg Party
